member_organisations:
Membership of the EACR is open to individuals studying or working in cancer research.  Organisations can become Sustaining Members to support our work: https://www.eacr.org/sustaining-members. 
 
The EACR has 14 affiliated national cancer societies.  A list can be found at: https://www.eacr.org/membership/national-societies
fields_of_interest: Budget, Education and training, Taxation, Research and innovation, Public Health
head_office_address: Sir Colin Campbell Building Triumph Road
eu_initiatives: The EACR is focused on EU policies and programmes relating to scientific research, particularly cancer research. More broadly, it is also interested in scientific education and training.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Founding partner of the Clinical Academic Cancer Research Forum (CAREFOR): http://www.eortc.org/carefor/
relevant_communication:
The EACR disseminates information about EU consultations to its members and, where appropriate, will respond on behalf of its members.  Most recently this has related to CanCon (Cancer Control Joint Action) and Horizon 2020.  The EACR also distributes information about EU funding calls that might be of interest to its members. 
 
The EACR works to raise awareness of the importance of scientific research and the need for sustained funding to support its members' work.
goals__remit: The EACR is a membership organisation for cancer researchers.  Its aim is the advancement of cancer research for the public benefit, from basic research to prevention, treatment and care. It has more than 10,000 members around the world from students to Nobel Prize winners.  It aims to galvanise excellence in multidisciplinary cancer research by fostering interactions between researchers, organising cutting edge scientific meetings, educating the next generation of cancer scientists and campaigning for cancer research with funders, policy-makers and society.
